channel.title: Simple questions about the client
channel.description:
I'm going to make this short and to the point
1) *IF* we were to reinvent aryan, coundn't we get trapped if the client does'nt send any data on how the mouse is moving? PSB said that there was a system in the client that documented all mouse movements and sent them to the server. If the server doesn't receive this wouldn't we get banned? And if we sent fake mouse data, couldn't they check it and find that we aren't actually moving the mouse?
2) Does the client record keystrokes and send them to the Runescape server?
Thanks!

item.title: Simple questions about the client
item.dc:creator: @Silver_Lining Silver Lining
item.description:
@Silver_Lining wrote:

At least you read, but I must say this: these are simple questions from one who is, as one infers from your talk of reinventing aryan, simple.

Read full topic

item.title: Simple questions about the client
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

The answers are 1. Yes and 2. Yes

The solution is to perfectly emulate input in a 100% undetectable way, this can be done with something like Cherokee

Read full topic

item.title: Simple questions about the client
item.dc:creator: @Ace Ace
item.description:
@Ace wrote:

*IF* we were to reinvent aryan
We wouldn't.
couldn't we get trapped if the client does'nt send any data on how the mouse is moving? PSB said that there was a system in the client that documented all mouse movements and sent them to the server. If the server doesn't receive this wouldn't we get banned? And if we sent fake mouse data, couldn't they check it and find that we aren't actually moving the mouse?
This is part of the reason why pure Action Forcing is so detectable. By getting the screen position of the NPC/Object/whatever you can simulate "smooth" mouse events on the applet component. The implementation of HOW you get the position of where to move is key in detectability.
2) Does the client record keystrokes and send them to the Runescape server?
Yes.

Read full topic
